arStrings.szText: Who's asking? Ah...apologies, wanderer. Do you need something?
Defensive, before catching himself and softening. Life has made him jaded but he tries not to let it.
What's this? A letter? (sigh) "...this may never reach you..." Oh no. No, no. Where did you get this?
At first, he's no sure what he's being handed. As he reads part of the letter aloud, he grows disbelieving.
"The Drowned...closing in..." And all this time, I've been ashamed of me father. I thought he abandoned us.
Continuing to read part of a letter aloud, he then confesses he's always been bitter and ashamed of his background. He thought his father left his family; this letter is revealing he got lost at sea.
And this? Wait--I've seen something like this before. An amulet imbued with druidic power.
With recognition, he descibes the item the player is handing him, though he hasn't seen it in decades.
This is a relic...f-from when I was a child, when our people still practiced the old ways. Ah but I fear now I--I've not the ability to use it.
Unless...c-could you use it? Me father wouldn't have wanted it collecting dust on a shelf.
Realizing, as he gets an idea, then hopeful.
I wish Mum was here to see...well, at least now her spirit can rest easy. Thank you, friend.
